Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ThurmanMurman
Reviews.Content: I arrived for a quick stay-over for the evening in Indianapolis on my way to Detroit. This hotel is a great property with clean rooms, lobby and hallways. The staff were very helpful in getting me settled and were very friendly... Gotta love the midwest! The room was spacious and the bathrooms seemed to have been renovated recently. Located close to the hospitals and industry on the north side of Indy. A great Four Points property and I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: RomeInJanuary
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights while in the Indianapolis area for a funeral. The hotel is one of the nicest Four Points I've ever stayed in...absolutely lovely! Nice area and nice amenities. Totally worth the short 17-minute drive into Indianapolis. We used Starwood's "points" and cash. (Gotta tell you - Starwood has the BEST awards program of the major hotel chains). The staff were extremely courteous and very helpful. When in the Indy area...we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Likes2Fly-82
Reviews.Content: We booked 8 rooms for a school choir competition. The staff was very friendly and helped greatly with check-in. Beds were very comfortable. More elevators would be nice as there are only two and they are not the fastest in the world. Wish they had a breakfast deal for Starwood Platinum members. Going to miss them on April 1 as they leave the Starwood brand. Loss for Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suburban Property”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: Easy and friendly check in and check out. Great rate with full breakfast, can't be beat. Sad that the property will no longer be part of SPG starting on April 1. Rooms were clean for the most part, a little rough on the edges throughout the property. Elevators barely worked and smelled like the engine was smoking or something as they were not the greatest. Location is in a suburban office park which could become confusing to get to from I-465 and Meridian St/College Ave. Plenty of restaurants/shopping within 10 minutes and downtown about 30 minutes down Meridian.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot for tennis tournaments and look for good deals. Breakfast included is always important so we were fortunate to find that they had a Breakfast for a Buck special voucher. Only had to pay for child's buffet which was only $4.00. Very convenient location quiet off the main road. Special plus was the voucher to use the local 5 Seasons Tennis and Fitness Club. Great fitness facility was only blocks away. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: notboca
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice clean rooms with very comfortable beds. We be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelRichCinti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Four Points for Super Bowl weekend when it was full, full, full. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. We were sitting in the indoor pool area having our morning coffee when the staff engineer came to check the water in the pool. Five minutes later he returned with a pot of hot coffee and cream for us so that we could refill our cups. Five minutes after that he was back with his home baked bread and home made honey butter so we could have a snack. Incredible!!! When we returned from the Super Bowl at 10:45pm tired and hungry, imagine our surprise and delight that the hotel had kept their restaurant open because they knew there would be people like us desperate for something to eat. The are fine and indoor poll was nice, but the service is the best I have ever seen and I've stayed in Top 10 in the world hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: I travel to Indianapolis every month for business and this is the first time i've stayed at this hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The guy at the front desk looked up where I could get a sandwich close by. He also let me know where the closest mall was so I could do a little shopping. Kyle, the bartender, he is wonderful! Very friendly, remembers your name, what you're drinking, does fun bar tricks. Really made me feel welcomed and like I wasn't traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality, clean, and a great bartender”
Reviews.Author: Dean R R
Reviews.Content: I travel here for work, and it's very uncommon when people recommend hanging out and eating dinner at the hotel bar. In addition to clean rooms and a nice decor, there's Kyle the bartender. At dinner time he greets guests with a warm welcome and serves up cold frosty beverages. He is the best bartender, bar none (pun intended). This is a gorgeous hotel at a great price, and serving good food and drinks. After dinner there's a well-equipped gym to work it off, and a jacuzzi to wind down.

Reviews.Title: “Average business hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwhaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Points for 3 nights during a weekday stay for a business conference. I paid ~$95 a night booked through a popular travel website which was on par for several other hotels nearby. The Good: Friendly and helpful staff, clean room, comfortable bed, good room cleaning and service during the day while I was out, plenty of hot water and standard hotel amenities, lap pool and hot tub were nice and not crowded with kids. The Bad: Wireless connectivity sucked all three days (slow, dropped connections, flaky DNS). If you need to get serious work done that requires high-speed internet, I'd stay somewhere else. No free breakfast (they wanted $10.95 for cafe style breakfast), dirty hallways, bad layout (you had to go outside through the courtyard to get to the elevators or walk all the way around the side of the hotel - in November), and don't expect any privacy in the business center, which is literally inside the concierge/grocery store/coffee area. The hotel was also difficult to find if you're not from the Indy area and familiar with some of the side streets. Summary: If you're passing through and need a comfortable bed for $100 a night, it's an option. I feel sorry for the staff who are really friendly and doing their best with a hotel that's obviously suffering in this economy. If management fixed their wireless service and included breakfast (come on guys... for $100 a night you can't throw in some bagels and donuts?) they would get better reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: Nancy H
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was the best that I have worked with in 22 years, especially with taking a large group of teenagers. Every single staff member went overboard to serve us. The hotel food was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Latvian Evangelical Lutheran Church of America 2011 Conference”
Reviews.Author: Gunars K
Reviews.Content: Very helpful professional staff provided great service during our guest's stay at the Four Points during a very hectic weekend. We have heard nothing but compliments from our group. Gunars Z. Kancs

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: cpnestel
Reviews.Content: My hubby had a medical procedure in the area and the doctor's office gave us a list of nearby hotels, which is how we ended up here. It was a nice stay. The rooms are a bit worn but it is obvious they try to make up for it with nice touches.

Reviews.Title: “Fastest Check in I have ever seen!!”
Reviews.Author: suzieq50
Reviews.Content: My DH and I were in town to visit traveling son. We pricelined this property and were thrilled with the results! Our room was clean and looked as if it had been newly refurbished. The property looked to be full. No noise from the hallway or from outside. Lovely bathroom - refrig in the room (love that - better for leftovers!!). We spent two nights. Would stay there again, for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: bobodawg
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a soccer tournament. The rooms are very small, as is the bathroom. The room was clean. The swimming facility is small as well. I did have trouble using the WiFi the first night and someone was to come to look into the problem, however, they never showed. We did need an extra pillow and it was received promptly. I wish there was a coffee table in the room, only a small desk. It's hard for a family with two kids to eat in the room between games. There were signs that the place was in the process of updating, which is a good thing.We were provided with a breakfast buffet. Keeping up the food provided was a slow process and we had to eat in a hurry, so there were slim pickings. The dining room provided was not cleaned and I had to push dirty plates and glasses away to find a seat for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Kyle the bartender is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Hdcrow
Reviews.Content: Kyle is the reason I am rating this hotel a 5. If it wasn't for him I would not be returning. He is a great business professional & awesome at customer service. He is an asset to this hotel and I would recommend anyone staying at this hotel to visit with him. A thumbs up for Kyle.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JustaHoosier
Reviews.Content: The Four Points by Sheraton-Carmel is a great place to stay for a few nights. It was clean and comfortable. Ask for a room away from the interstate side, as we did, and it was quiet. The courtyard was very nice. We will stay there again when in the area. A bit pricey for the average person who doesn't have an expense account, but if you find a special rate online it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations...”
Reviews.Author: RSNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as it was convenient for business and great value and also I am very loyal to Starwood. I have stayed in several Four Points in the past, and this location was far and away the best and the entire staff made sure my short stay was fantastic in every way. From the very apprecitive welcoming of a platinum guest, nothing seemed to be too much to ask from the wine and cheese in room to the special breakfast prepared for me before I left at 6 am since the room service had not started, Would highly reccomend to anyone in the area and sure I will get back when my travels take me that way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the great service at the Carmel Four Points. We were especially impressed with Kyle who served us in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not fabulous, but not bad.”
Reviews.Author: tbowes
Reviews.Content: Typical semi full service suburban hotel that is a bit dated. The hotel was previously a Radisson, and prior to that, a Wyndham Garden Hotel. The rooms and public areas are clean, and sufficient. Nice lounge for an evening cocktail. Very attractive courtyard area. Just fine for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful surprise, couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: BDfromDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel purely for Starwood points and a good price, as I have not been a fan of the older, run-down Sheratons coverted to Four Points in the past. But this was a fantastic stay in every way. Fun bar, great restaurant with good food and service, and a very nice guest room with traditional, well-made furniture instead of the IKEA crap that you get in most hotels these days. It changed my perception of the entire Four Points brand. Staff could not have been better, effficent and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cbce1pjb
Reviews.Content: Hotwired this hotel for $ 60/night. About 25 min from downtown Indy. Overall,Carmel is a very nice area. Monon community center In Carmel is outstanding for the water park ,bike trails etc. The only negative would be the T.V. system could use some upgrading.Internet worked fine.This hotel is nicer than some hotels that I have paid twice the price.I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: BobSouthBend_IN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter who was here for college orientation. What a very nice location. The hotel itself was great and the location was even better. We ended up at Bub's for dinner and then happened upon a concert in Carmel. We will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwoods13
Reviews.Content: This was a clean hotel with friendly front-desk people. My only concern was that it is in a business park and is somewhat confusing to find off the highway. If you don't enter through the correct entrance, you can see the hotel and park frustratingly close at a nearby business complex, but not inside the hotel parking lot. They also had a buffet breakfast for $12, but typically these middle-range hotels have free continentals, so the competition might beat it. However, for the price we got it for, it was a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Treated us like family”
Reviews.Author: geestacy
Reviews.Content: July 22, 2011 Dear Mr. Utz, I wanted to take a moment and let you know about my recent stay at your property last week. Our group of ladies from Alpha Zeta Beta sorority had a fabulous time at your hotel. Even though we were a small group, your property made us feel as if your entire staff was dedicated to only us, contrary to the fact that there were other guests staying in the hotel. Stephanie at the front desk was friendly and accommodating with every request I made from her. House cleaning staff cleaned and then came back around most afternoons to make sure everything was ok and did we need anything. Ramon was efficient and friendly whenever he was serving us in banquets or the dining room. He made sure we knew if we needed anything to just ask. Kyle the bartender is a gem. I say this as I have 20 years experience in the restaurant business and he knows the meaning of guest service. He made us feel like we were walking into his house each day when we entered his bar. Zac the manager was a man of many hats during our stay, he was visible and available all day. I often found myself wondering if he slept at all during our event as I saw him first thing in the morning and last thing at night. He even went above and beyond by driving one of our ladies to the local Mejjer store to pick up a few things when no one else was available. Finally, Derek the chief engineer of the property did double duty as our van driver and took us wherever we wanted to go and happily picked us up when we were ready. It was so refreshing to see a group of individuals work so well together and wear so many different hats. They all did whatever job was at hand and needed tending to, and with a smile on their face to boot. You should be very proud of them as they exemplify the true meaning of guest service. Please extend my deepest appreciation to all of them for making our 86th National Convention a roaring success! I hope to have the opportunity to stay at your property again in the future as I know it is a place where I can feel at home. Kind Regards, Stacy Graham AZB National President

Reviews.Title: “1998 Tube TV...where is the HD?”
Reviews.Author: pondscum2
Reviews.Content: While I was pleased to see they comped Wifi unlike other SPG properties I have stayed at recently, there is absolutely no excuse for the terrible TV's they have. Seriously, when I flipped on Seinfeld on TBS, I could have swore I was again living in 1998. They did a nice job with the lipstick on the room from the previous owners, however, like most Four Point Properties, if you look past the common areas, you see sloppy-seconds from a previous owner/operator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Job”
Reviews.Author: tpnindy
Reviews.Content: We recently held a small convention at the hotel and was very pleased with our stay. Everyone on the staff was very accomadating, friendly and helpful. Ramone in the banquet service and resturant wait staff was truly impressive always running to help, our group and those of us coordinating the event loved him. Lateia at the front desk, Kyle and Kevin in the bar and Zack of the managerial staff were all phenomenal and extremley helpful. I would say that the hotel might even be short staff in some areas like the cafe' wait staff or banquet services in that one or two people are constantly working in the areas and are obviously doing the work of two to three people. This was very obvious on Saturday morning with the arrival of another small group and weekend travelers. We watched as one woman was expected to bring drinks, bus tables and cash out patrons for more than 40 people. She was a tropper, and was taking on the challange with grace, but several of us were half way through our meals before she was able to take our drink order. Some guests might have been less understanding and taken that out on her which would have been unfortuante and not her fault. Also, I have to comment on the food service for the banquets. Our group conducts this event annually in many hotels across the country and almost every person in attendance was impressed by the quality of the banquet meals. Every single meal was very good. As for the facilities. The hotel rooms were nice and comfortable but I was a bit shocked that the rooms are still furnished with tube TV's instead of LCD or plasma considering that the lobby and business areas seem to be updated with some of the most recent technology. The rest of the hotel was clean, comfortable, and cozy even with the damage from the recent fire. I didn't get to utilize the lap pool or fitness equipment but I heard from others in our group that they were clean and updated. I do think that the hotel with it's distracting location next to the interstate might attract more businees by putting in a standard size outdoor pool. As we expected, that was the one complaint of those in our group. Overall, we were very pleased with our expereince at the Four Points Sheraton; a few updates, a couple more on staff with the same work ethic that currently seems to be established amongst those already in place, and a nice outdoor pool would make this a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful service, avoid”
Reviews.Author: jp3492
Reviews.Content: I travel to the Indy area quite frequently, and as an SPG Gold member, I had been meaning to check this hotel out, as it would be pretty handy for my business trips. I had the opportunity yesterday and was very disappointed. This was *not* booked on the cheap, due to the last minute nature of the trip, I paid almost a rack rate via SPG.com The good - my check in at 2am (late flights) was friendly and considerate. The lady on reception explained that due to some recent fire damage, the property was not in top shape, but the stay would be warm and welcoming. So far so good. The bad - The rooms at rear of the property are about 75' from the freeway, there are tractor trailers rumbling by all night. The Iron did not work properly, there was a nice big black unidentified hair to greet me on the bathroom seat and there were no extra pillows in the room. Okay, put in earplugs, have creased clothes and wipe of the toilet seat with a wet wipe, not the end of the world, but disappointing nevertheless for a 'premium' hotel. The unacceptable - As it was approaching 3am I decided to book breakfast in the room, as I had an early start. Filled in the form, stated a time and hung it on my door. I woke up about an hour later as the door handle was rattled by somebody picking it up (seriously!) Next morning, surprise surprise, no sign of breakfast. Called the restraunt, no reply and time was running short so I had to go. While waiting for the elevator, coming up, I was treated to two of the houskeeping staff, f-ing and blinding to each other as the elevator approached. I was then treated by the 'thousand yard stare' as I attempted to get myself and my bag onboard. Not nice. I got to the desk and enquired about my missing breakfast and more importantly whether I had been charged for something I did not receive. The young lady behind the desk went immediately into 'attitude' mode and told me straight away that I hadn't put my room number on the form. Probably true, but you see as I explained, I filled it out at 3am after 12 hours of travel and I may have overlooked that. Wait, wasn't it collected off my door? Her response was it was not her problem nor the staffs responsibility to check if the room number is on the order as IT COMES OFF THE DOOR!!!!! By her immediate response, I'm guessing this happens a lot (I for one missed where the number goes), but rather than spend two nanoseconds checking on the form it's much easier not to make the effort. How many breakfast orders can there be? 20? 30? 10? It's not hard. I was really offended by the whole head swaying 'talk to the hand' attitude. I would have been so easy to fix this - 1.) Sorry about that sir 2.) Next time you'll notice theres a room number space on the form 3.) Do you have time to eat in the dining room? 4.) If not, how about a cup of joe and a danish to go? I asked to speak to the duty manager and she said 'fill in a feedback form' or the dining room is over there if you want to speak to the manager. Needless to say I won't ever stay here again and will make sure I warn people of the same.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunseekerMi
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Sheraton has great beds, so comfortable. The staff were very informative and helpful. The hotel was very clean.The only negative was the pool was extremely cold, we couldn't swim in it.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: lm8731
Reviews.Content: I called downstairs for a blanket and extra towels when my family and I checked in late our first night. The front desk staff cheerfully told me they would be up right away, and five minutes later, they were delivered. When we had to cancel our last night because my mother unexpectedly needed surgery, they canceled my room at no charge with no problem. The hotel's lobby was very nice and bright, and the rooms (while a little older than we are used to seeing) were very clean (and I am a "neat freak"). The free high-speed internet was an unexpected benefit too, as was the sound machine that allowed us to sleep to the sound of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, staff, and service”
Reviews.Author: Dyoung7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was immaculate with an onsite restaurant. The location was near the highway but secluded enough for quiet and privacy. The staff was friendly and accessible with Guest Services Manager Zachary M. Donofrio providing fast and efficient service. The hotel was quiet and provided white noise machines in the room. The beds were comfortable and bathrooms clean with large tubs. The internet was fast and consistent which made traveling for work much easier. The television did not have the best reception most likely a faulty cable wire.

Reviews.Title: “Have Stayed Here Probably 10 Times”
Reviews.Author: ATLconsultant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 1998 when it was a Wyndham Garden Inn, then in 2005 when it was a full service Wyndham, did not stay here when it was a Radisson, but have stayed here twice as a Four Points hotel. The best has been full service Wyndham and now. The staff is courteous. Our rate is ungodly good. The beds are comfortable. The place serves food. It's within walking distance to our office. How much better can it get? Once they had a problem with hot water. They reached out to us to offer us some goodies/incentives to give them another shot. Class act. We did give them another shot and they succeeded.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: dvanauker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a weekend in Indy to meet friends. Check in was smooth, bed was comfortable and clean and accommodations were great overall. We appreciated the sleep-noise machine with several choices. Good complimentary coffee in the morning. Staff was polite and professional. Would definitely stay here again. Location was good for both downtown and Broadripple areas, which we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Chemicalguy123
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for about 10 hours but it was a good stay. The room was large and the beds were comfortable. The parking was free and there were a couple of computers with free internet access. The shower had lots of pressue and plenty of hot water. The hotel is pretty far from anything so you will need reliable transportation to get around. The front desk seemed to be busy and a bit flustered but I wouldn`t avoid this hotel based on that. All in all, I would recommend a stay here if you`ve got a car and are in the Indianapolis area.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - good value”
Reviews.Author: crt5
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel Monday through Thursday for the last nine months, so I know the staff and the facility very well, and I can honestly say that they really do everything they can for me. As mentioned by several other reviewers, Kyle, the bartender at their Terra Nova restaurant, is a particular pleasure. He really does a great job of encouraging conversation among the guests, and of making everyone comfortable and relaxed. The food at the restaurant is also surprisingly good. I have also received excellent service from Zack at the front desk, and Tamra in the sales department. Overall, I would say that the hotel is an excellent value for the location. The facilities are a bit dated, but everything is generally clean and well maintained. Internet service is much better than at any of the other local hotels in this price range, though it can be spotty in the rooms farthest from the elevator on lower floors. Not really an issue though, as the front desk agreed to move me to another room every time this came up, and the reception in the lobby is excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Bartender is outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: ROBT_11
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel frequently; and when I am in town and not staying in at this hotel, I always stop to have a drink at the bar. The hotel is comfortable and convenient. Kyle, the bartende,r is the best; he makes everyone feel welcome and facilitates interesting conversations among the patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Clean, Needs A Few Updates”
Reviews.Author: lushou
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly here and the property was clean. The rooms are slightly outdated but in good condition. The pool area really needed to be updated, but it was clean. This was a good value for us!

Reviews.Title: “was very nice place and the staff was very pleasent”
Reviews.Author: reneissexy
Reviews.Content: kyle the bartender was very nice and helpful food was great and the manager zach was also very nice

Reviews.Title: “Room comfortable, a little noisy, pool water cold”
Reviews.Author: ilovemanu_1999
Reviews.Content: My family (with 2 small children) received a very nice room. It was clean and comfortable. We went to the pool, and the water was cold. You eventually get use to it. Towels weren't readily available but the hotel staff did drop some off by the time we finished. I did hear some footsteps up above at night. It didn't bother me that much. But I was a little annoyed with our neighbors door slamming shut at night coming and going. It was quite loud but not loud enough to cause my children to wake up in the middle of the night. I only had reservation for one night so I put up with it.

Reviews.Title: “Kyle the Bartender is a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: LMNC0126
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a standard hotel - nothing fancy, but clean. When traveling for business I don't really look for a fun bar experience, however, Kyle the bartender provided great service and entertainment for myself and colleagues. Overall service at the hotel was excellent - every person I dealt with was very polite. Rooms could be updated, and the layout of the hotel with elevators in the middle back is a bit confusing.

Reviews.Title: “awsome bartender”
Reviews.Author: sam_darlene
Reviews.Content: i have stayed in your hotel on several trips. I keep coming back because your bartender, Kyle, is awesome. He makes everyone feel special. I love playing his game on heavy weight champions. yes i will return. give the guy a raise. haha

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Sugarfreecupcake
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at this Four points. The rooms were clean, the bathroom was large and the shower was really hot! The bed was comfortable and they have little machines that you use to make your room sound like the ocean or a crickets. My favorite part was the little bar in the lobby area! The bartender KYLE was simply amazing. I felt like I was on an episode of Cheers! He asked our names and then used them the entire length of our stay! I would suggest this hotel to anyone who wants to get away for a while. Business or pleasure this is a nice hotel! If you go, make sure you go see Kyle, he wont let ya down! ENJOY your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff and outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbr123
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel staff at desk. Unable to talk to manager. Said manger is not in building. How can that be when it is 10am on a weekday. Just gave an 800 number to call. When you do call you get run around transfrered from one person to another. Overcharged for room. No towels in pool area. Desk says housekeeping will bring them never does. Room wallpaper peeling. Old tube TV's with poor reception. Would not recommend or stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: earlgreyjunior
Reviews.Content: This hotel has customer service down to a tee. I've stayed here a few times, and as a weary traveler from England, there is nothing better than the reception I get here. As soon as I step through the door, the staff recognize me, and know my name. I get to feel at home. Kyle, the barman, has a great knowledge of beer, and they have amazing local craft beers on tap. Zac, on front of house, will do anything to make your life easy - he just leant me his Blackberry charger because I forgot mine. Tamara, manager, is always willing to talk about how we can work together as businesses. Margaret, in the restaurant, knows what I like for breakfast. Great staff are worth more than anything else. I hope that the owners realize what a gem they have here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great bar”
Reviews.Author: amchap11
Reviews.Content: Kyle, the bartender, does a great job of making everyone feel welcome. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jdittmar
Reviews.Content: Kyle at the bar was very entertaining and made everyone comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great service from Kyle!”
Reviews.Author: jscheck
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from Kyle. Entertained us while watching ball game with clever conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Carmel.”
Reviews.Author: smattson7
Reviews.Content: I would definately recommend this hotel. Clean rooms, great service, and the bar downstairs is great. The bartenders name is Kyle and he is fantastic. Very entertaining...and stays open late!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in the Restaurant/Bar”
Reviews.Author: meysoldt
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and spend around 110 nights per year in a hotel room. The rooms were nice at this hotel. I happened to be here for 4 days during the snowstorm of 2011. We did have some hot water issues and they had trouble getting the parking lot cleared, but overall the hotel was nice. The reason I am writing this is to highlight the outstanding service received from Kyle the bartender! Normally after a long day on the road I just want to eat dinner and get to bed, but this guy did such an outstanding job! If you get a chance, you should visit this hotel and plan on having a nice meal and drink at the bar, you will not be disappointed. Kyle went out of his way to learn everyone's name, introduce everyone and while he stayed busy the entire evening, I never felt rushed. Job well done Kyle, you are a true asset to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bartender Named Kyle”
Reviews.Author: Jeff37209
Reviews.Content: I wanted to let you know how welcome we felt at your hotel. We had several meetings in the restaurant. Kyle was very friendly and handled our requests promptly and in a very professional manner. We will highly recommend the hotel and look forward to seeing Kyle again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: JoeKurtz
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling on business to the Four Points Sheraton every other week for about 1 year. Every time, without fail, as I arrive at the hotel I am greeted by name and with a handshake from Kyle. The service is always great, the room always very clean and the meals always hot and fresh. Thank you making me feel at home!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Travellover1869
Reviews.Content: For a rate of only $69 on a saturday night, I did not have high expectations for this hotel. I was surprised however. The lobby features a restaurant and bar, there's a pool, hot tub, fitness center, and business center. Room was well appointed, clean, quiet, and comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Would definitely recommend to anybody going to Indy!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value”
Reviews.Author: legaleagle76_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value, well worth the money. The front desk staff was very friendly, efficient, fast and knowledgeable. They suggested an upgrade without being asked!! The hotel lobby is very nice. The rooms are spacious, clean and well maintained. The beds were heaven and even the towels were exceptional. Even though the hotel is located near the interstate, there was no outside noise and we were not disturbed. My only complaint was that the bathtub drained a little too slowly and we had to go outside, through a courtyard, to get to the elevator. Other than that, our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bartender”
Reviews.Author: nandom
Reviews.Content: Kyle -- spot on -- remembering drink orders!! Rooms great! Bed awesome! Breakfast bar -- very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kermitthefrog66
Reviews.Content: Was on property for a 3 day meeting and enjoyed my stay. There were new faces at the desk and they were very friendly. Room was comfortable and clean. Everything was in working order. TV's and furniture need to be upgraded. Internet was excellent. Breakfast was good - nothing special. I would recommend the property. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: sam_darlene
Reviews.Content: room was great. everybody was very nice and friendly. styed two nights. spent time in the bar with kyle the bartender. very outstanding. loved his little show and his very outgoing personality. will be back to your hotel when in your area again. .

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: QueenAngel71
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Doubletree but decided to stay at the Four Points - better rate and closer to the office. What a nice find! The hotel is very clean but most importantly the staff was very accommodating and friendly. We'll be back for certain!

Reviews.Title: “About Average”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: Quiet hotel with plenty of parking and nice people. Effort is made to keep the place clean, but still some of the pillows had this yucky pilled-up fabric and in general the hotel could use a refurbishment. I've stayed at worse, but I won't rush to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: dadxs3
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with great employees. I stayed for two nights and had great service the entire stay. From front desk checking me in and upgrading me to a suite to breakfast everything was great ( especially the muffin tops) and the server really talked to me, not at me. Internet was fast and EASY. The hotel is hidden in a quite and beautiful office park setting but easy to get to everything. The bar was a real treat, friendly people, great atmosphere. I had room service one night (good) and went out the 2nd night. Front desk recommended a real winner for something unique to the area. Really made the trip. Thanks, I WILL be back to this hotel when returning to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service and Stay”
Reviews.Author: IowaFan87835
Reviews.Content: The Four Points staff is amazingly customer focused. We conducted training at the Four Points and Ramon, the banquet captain was available and helpful to us the entire visit. He did an awesome job!Planning with the catering staff was a collaborative and pleasant experience from start to finish. The front desk and restaurant staff remember your name and you cannot help but feel you are in a caring hospitable environment. if you are planning meetings this is a wonderful spot to hold them. The hotel staff exceed expectations and are proud of their service. That is hard to find these days!

Reviews.Title: “Most dishonest housekeeping staff I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: 3myers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Points in Carmel near Indianapolis. We will NEVER stay there again and urge you to think twice about staying there. If you stay DO NOT leave anything of ANY value in your room or it may come up missing. We left on Sunday and on our way home our son mentioned he left something in a drawer (which was placed there, ironically so it wouldn't get stolen when housekeeping came in to clean up our room the previous day.) We turned around to drive 45 minutes back to hear that nothing was found in our room after we had checked out. This item wasn't small and the staff that went in to double check the room with us started looking under items such as the ice bucket. We asked to speak to the manager, he was unavailable as was the housekeeping supervisor who handles all lost and found issues. My husband called several times throughout the evening to speak to the manager of the hotel. It wasn't until almost 10 PM that he got to speak with him. Of course by that time, the housekeeping supervisor wasn't available either. The manager stated that he would talk to staff involved and would get back to us the following morning. And surprisingly, nobody knew anything the following morning. All I know is someone that had access with a room key had to have helped them disappear into thin air. Now I have a child, who had worked hard for everything that was stolen, trying to figure out why people steal and why he can't have his stuff back. SO I advise you, be careful with your possessions if you choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Room was o.k. and lied to about bogus room charge”
Reviews.Author: CatsFan3
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at the hotel for the Final Four. The room was a typical hotel room,clean but not great, cleaning staff kept coming early and hotel bar was best part of stay. After returning home, I noticed a bogus room charge for $156 about a wek or two later on my credit card. Called the hotel and was told that day it would be taken care. Waited a couple weeks and no reverse of charge. Called again and was told it was reversed and asked for an email confirmation. I never received an email and called again. I finally spoke to the general manager who told me the charge was reversed only a few days earlier (i.e. the previous day I called). The general manager was finally able to correct the problem. Based on the service received at the hotel and the poor customer service after, I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Next time I go to Indy, I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great night's sleep AND helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: eeh13
Reviews.Content: Smooth check in, friendly staff, CLEAN hotel, and a great night's sleep. It was a Saturday night on a busy weekend in Indianapolis but this was a quiet and restful place to stay. Some of the older reviews on this site are more negative -- they're not true now! I come to Indy frequently and I'll stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: kermitthefrog66
Reviews.Content: I was in INDY for a week and enjoyed my stay at the Four Points. The staff was friendly, Gabby, Flora and Latia. Margaret in the Cafe was always attentive. Kyle at the bar was a joy - kept you entertained and before you knew it the bar was closing. Not much to do around the hotel but easy commute to area malls. Recommend for weekday or weekend travelers. Will stay again when in INDY/Carmel. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler323
Reviews.Content: From the drive into the hotel all the way to my room I experienced a luxury experience. The staff was delightful and very accommodating. The food was fabolus. The room was very spacious which was nice when I just wanted to stay in and relax. The sleep number bed was a great experience! I truly enjoyed my stay and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: vremington
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean and smells very nice...Beds are comfortable, rooms very spacious. Staff goes above and beyond to provide superior service from a restaurant server and front desk agent to hotel management...Keep up great work! Very beautiful Courtyard!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kensipe
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often... and this was the worst experience for a hotel check in that I can recall. I don't know what other tasks this lady was trying to perform / complete... but I was clearly last priority. After waiting an extended period of time to start the check in process (with no one else in line mind you), she receives a phone call midway through the process the conversation of which was trivial. If this hotel wasn't as convenient to where I wanted to be I would have left. There were issues with the wireless connection as well... can't say that is a hotel issue, however there is a lot of confusion that frustrated other conversations further based on the hotel name.... raddison vs. sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean, but loud expressway noise in south facing rooms”
Reviews.Author: MaireadWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, there was a large convention of builders, check-in clerk kindly put us away from the group and said to call if anyone was loud. Very nice service, new carpet, sofa, bedding. The biggest drawback was the extremely loud noise from the expressway (TV small and old but I don't care about that with free internet available here). This hotel was built maybe 13 years ago as a Wyndham. The negative reviews on Tripadvisor scared me, but I was very happy (if I had remembered the expressway noise warning I would have asked for another room, but I travel with a fan to cancel out noise and it worked in this case). I had an excellent rate from Priceline, I may not have been happy to pay the regular rate. I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Prepaid and Snow Storm”
Reviews.Author: jankuck
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room on Tuesday for the following Sat. over the phone. The confirmation e-mail came, I did not read it all...(my own fault) it was made by the staff as an online prepaid reservation and I was not informed of that. By Friday a storm arrived and our reservation needed to be moved back one week. They gave me an 800 number, they refused, I called back and talked to a second person... he refused as well. It does not seem like good business to not inform a caller that his reservation is made as if online. If that was what I wanted I would have made it myself. So where do you think I will stay next week ?

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL AND MANAGEMENT YOU EVER WILL SEE!! DO NOT STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: Ryry0801
Reviews.Content: I am going to keep this brief!! This Is By Far The Worst Hotel Ever- Loud, Staff Is Rude, Charge Your Credit Card For Things You Don't Buy, Don't Return Phone Calls When You Inquire About Charges, Just Straight Up The Worst!! Save Your $$$$$$$$$$$$ and Go Else Where Plenty Of Options in the City!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: wktraveller09
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure. This hotel was alright. Nothing fancy. Quiet. Tiny fitness room. Tube TV's from the 90's. Overpriced food. Most of all it's all by itself. Make sure you have a car if you go here. There is NOTHING in walking distance. My review is for their incredible lack of customer service. I called the GM to solve an incorrect charge to my account ($650!! worth of incorrect charges) and he didn't bother to get back to me. To be fair he did call at 745 AM on a Saturday, 2 days after 2 calls and corporate complaints. The supervisor agreed it was their fault but could not change it until I solve their problem myself. Corporate customer service has been no better. They charged my account 4 days after my departure, without notifying me. And now it's been a week and no correction has been made.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for an overnight on our way though Indiana. Overall, I can't compain. Had a clean room, clean bed, and clean bathroom. But everything seemed slightly off. It's out of the way in a corporate area. However if you check-in after 11pm you have to use the buzzer to get in as if you were checking into a hotel in the ghetto. The hotel is doughnut shaped. The check-in is on one side and you have to walk all the way around to the other to go up the elevator. It was 30 degrees outside and the AC was on high in our hallway. Fortunatly the temprature was fine in the room. I can't really complain about the place, but there were things that just didn't feel right and were quite distracting.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Sgoes
Reviews.Content: After looking through the AAA book (3 stars) and trusting the Sheraton name, I booked this hotel through a web site. While the front of the hotel was fine, the rest of the hotel was very neglected. The pools were too cloudy to let the kids swim in. The wallpaper in the hallway was torn and a bannister was missing. The chair in our room was ripped and had stuffing coming out of it. The glasses and used coffee packets were never replaced in the three days we were there. Looks like a place that has really been neglected. The sheets and bathroom were clean but it sure isn't a 3 star destination!

HotelInfo.Name: Four Points by Sheraton Indianapolis Carmel
HotelInfo.Address: 251 Pennsylvania Parkway, Indianapolis, IN 46280
